sentences.sContent: Her electroscope was a metal case with two holes in its side.
sentences.sContent_eng: Her electroscope was a metal case with two holes in its side.
sentences.sCn: 她的验电器是一个金属盒子，旁边有两个小孔。

sentences.sContent: It was an electroscope which contained a small amount of radium.
sentences.sContent_eng: It was an electroscope which contained a small amount of radium.
sentences.sCn: 这是一个验电器，其中载有少量的镭。

sentences.sContent: As there was already pre-charge applied to the electroscope , an additional little charge caused reaction.
sentences.sContent_eng: As there was already pre-charge applied to the electroscope , an additional little charge caused reaction.
sentences.sCn: 由于已经有预充电适用于验电器，额外收取很少引起的反应。

trans.tranOther: an apparatus for detecting an electric charge, typically consisting of a rod holding two gold foils that separate when a charge is applied
